page.title: 14MY GRANDA'S BIOGRAPHY.
page.content: My granda John Smith was born 27th Ap- ril 1907 at the Headland Hartlepool in Alfred Street. You had to pay 4p a week to attend school He started when he was 5 and left in 1921. His first job was at Richardson West garths. Then he worked at the fish house curing fish and kippers. He worked as a machinist at the Central Marine Engineering works until he retired. During the war 1939-1945 he was with the A.R.P. During the depression he walked to Greatham digging gardens for money to keep his family fed. He also acted as coffin bearer and had to borrow clothes to wear. He remembers being allowed out of school to deliver newspapers when there was special news about the war. BY ELIZABETH GOLDEN AGE 10
